newsitem.title: JAPAN: IBJ keeps long-term prime steady at 2.7% for Nov.
newsitem.headline: IBJ keeps long-term prime steady at 2.7% for Nov.

text.p: The Industrial Bank of Japan Ltd said on Monday it would keep its long-term prime rate for November steady at 2.7 percent from the previous month.
The long-term prime rate is what banks charge their best customers for loans of over one year.
Long-term banks customarily set their long-term prime rate 0.9 percentage point above that of the debenture coupon rate.
The latest IBJ debentures, which have a 1.8 percent coupon, were traded at a yield of 1.86 percent on Monday morning.
